title: Cargelligo victim speaks as police confirm possible shooter sighting | ABC NEWS
description: *WARNING - this story contains the names of Indigenous people who have died.* Kaleb Macqueen, the teenager who survived the shooting at Lake Cargellico which killed three others, has spoken about the moment he was gunned down. On day of the search for the alleged gunman, a possible sighting has led police to the isolated central western town of Mount Hope. title: PM appoints Defence Department secretary as next ambassador to US | ABC NEWS
description: Defence secretary Greg Moriarty has been named as the next ambassador to the United States.  In a wide-ranging interview with the ABC's Insiders program, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese also labelled US President Donald Trump's remarks about allies in Afghanistan "not acceptable", and confirmed Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney would visit Australia in March. title: Revisiting a double-decker bus journey around the world, decades later | ABC NEWS
description: In the swinging sixties Englishman Ron Sverdloff and his mates decided to drive around the world in a double-decker bus. Ron recently returned to Darwin to revisit the city he says kept the trip on track through six continents and thirty countries over three years. By Mitchell Abram for ABC News Northern Territory. title: Large parts of Australia forecast to swelter through week-long heatwave | ABC NEWS
description: Much of Australia is forecast to swelter through a major heatwave with record temperatures hitting many parts of the country on Australia Day.  The heatwave is expected to linger for a week, elevating fire dangers in South Australia’s south-western region before moving to south-eastern Australia.  The Bureau of Meteorology’s senior meteorologist Sarah Scully says the lack of strong cold fronts is allowing the heat to linger inland. title: Trump officials blame Minnesota authorities for ICE shooting of Alex Pretti | ABC NEWS
description: Scrutiny has intensified into a second deadly shooting of a US citizen by ICE agents in Minneapolis, with the Department of Homeland Security and the state of Minnesota launched separate investigations into the incident.  Senior officials in the Trump administration are shifting the blame for the death of Alex Jeffrey Pretti to Minnesota’s local law enforcement, with US Deputy Attorney-General Todd Blanche questioned why federal agents were not protected by local police.  Senior official in US Border Patrol Greg Bovino said immigration agents were the victims.  Minneapolis Mayor Jacob Frey is calling for the White House to withdraw ICE officers with local authorities challenging the legal right for ICE to operate in the city. title: The global outrage over Musk’s Grok AI image abuse | ABC News Daily podcast
description: Elon Musk’s AI tool, Grok, has caused global outrage after it made it really easy to virtually undress people via AI image editing.    Musk’s competitor to ChatGPT is integrated into the social media platform X and earlier this month users started asking it to do some pretty gross things.    X was flooded with images of semi-naked women, with users able to reply to anyone’s perfectly innocent picture and ask it to put them in a bikini, for example.    While Musk initially downplayed the scandal and was slow to act, he’s now put limits on the tool. But is that the end of the story and should X be banned?   Today, Sam Cole, a tech journalist and co-founder of 404 Media on the Grok scandal and how it enabled the exploitation and abuse of women.    Featured:    Sam Cole, co-founder of 404 Media

title: New Zealand landslide victims remembered at sunset vigil near Mt Maunganui | ABC NEWS
description: A sunset vigil has been held to honour the six victims of a deadly landslide which struck a popular campground on New Zealand’s North Island.  More than 100 community members attended the service at park near Mount Maunganui.  Police have released the identities of the victims including two teenagers who attended Auckland College.  New Zealand authorities had to suspend recovery efforts several times due to challenging weather conditions, prioritising the safety of the more than 30 emergency workers on the site. title: Meet the winners of the 2026 Australian of the Year awards | ABC NEWS
description: Space engineer and astronaut Katherine Bennell-Pegg has been named the 2026 Australian of the Year for making history as the first astronaut to qualify for Australia's space program. First Nations construction advocate Frank Mitchell was voted Australia’s Local Hero for 2026 for empowering young Indigenous Australians to access work in the construction industry. Endurance runner Nedd Brockmann clinched the Young Australian of the Year award after becoming the fatest Australian to run the 3,900 kilometre journey from Perth to Sydney to raise $2.6 million to combat homelessness.  Professor Henry Brodaty received the Senior Australian of the Year award for his research into ways to prevent or delay the onset of dementia. title: Foo Fighters reunite with Beaconsfield mine survivor | ABC NEWS
description: Foo Fighters lead singer Dave Grohl reunited with Beaconsfield Mine survivor Brant Webb at their Launceston concert In 2006, Todd Russell and Brant Webb spent 14 days trapped a kilometre underground after a mine collapse in Beaconsfield in Tasmania's north.   During the ordeal, the pair requested Foo Fighters's music to boost their spirits.
